newsitem.title: UK: British transsexual challenges sex-change refusal.
newsitem.headline: British transsexual challenges sex-change refusal.

text.p: A 51-year-old transsexual father of two won the right on Wednesday to a court hearing to try to force British health officials to pay for a sex-change operation.
"I am desperate to obtain the surgery required to give me a normal life," the transsexual, identified only as "K ", said in a written statement to the High Court.
The judicial review may be a major test case over the right of transsexuals to have sex change surgery at the cost of Britain's comprehensive state health service.
"K" will claim the refusal of the government-funded Shropshire Health Authority in western England to pay for his sex-change operation was unlawful .
After the hearing , his lawyer, Madeline Rees, said the case could have major implications for other health authorities facing similar requests.
"K "has undergone hormone therapy for nine years and doctors have given medical clearance for the operation.
In two similar recent cases in Britain, transsexuals have received the operation after medical officials changed their minds in the face of court challenges.
